abstracts.cdata!:
The Transmission Development Project
            will add new transformers and associated facilities at five
            existing substations located at Oshogbo, Kano, Onitsha,
            Benin, and Alaoji. This Environmental Policy Framework
            Evaluation (EPFE) examines the potential issues arising from
            construction of new facilities: a) impact to biological
            resources; b) impacts to human resources arising from
            construction of new facilities; c) noise related to
            construction and operation of large transformers; d) public
            and workplace health and safety associated with past
            management practices at existing substations, including the
            use and disposal of polychlorinated biphenyls (PCB)
            containing transformer oils; and e) contamination issues
            associated with ongoing management of facilities. The five
            existing locations all have sufficient land within existing
            perimeters to accommodate the proposed facilities, and no
            biological or social land use impacts are therefore
            anticipated. No residence or sensitive receptors were noted
            in close proximity to the substation sites, and so noise is
            not considered an issue. Leakage and uncontrolled disposal
            of PCB-containing oils has occurred at two existing
            facilities, which may present a risk to workers at the
            sites. To mitigate this, PCB tests will be conducted in all
            facilities initially. If the presence of PCB is confirmed, a
            Phase II audit will be conducted to develop new construction
            plans for minimizing contamination and human exposure.
